Typography.

Primary Typeface

Gotham is a family of widely used geometric sans-serif digital typefaces. We use it for headlines and throughout our designs. Unlike other sans-serif typefaces which might feel German or Swiss, Gotham feels very American. Gotham is available in eight weights—thin, extra light, light, book, medium, bold, black, and ultra—each with matching italics as well as narrow, x-narrow, and condensed widths.

Hyperlink styling

The default style for all links is underlined with a dashed border.

Primary Hyperlink

to the moon

Secondary Hyperlink

to the moon

Inverse Hyperlink

to the moon

No-Underline Hyperlink styling

Links without underlines are not the default style or pattern, but are provided as a an option for preexisting components that were built with no underlines as the pattern. You can achieve this look by adding .tsla-links--no_underline to a wrapping element.

This is not the default, and should be avoided for any new component development.

Primary Hyperlink

to the moon

Secondary Hyperlink

to the moon

Inverse Hyperlink

to the moon

code demo coming soon

List item styling

By default, list items have no type, no margin, and no padding. Adding either tsla-list--ordered or tsla-list--unordered to the <ol> or <ul>. The HTML should carry semantic meaning, so be sure to choose your markup correctly.

Each value for both margin and padding can be updated by adding one or more of the following variables to your code: --tsla-list_item-[margin|padding]_[top|right|bottom|left]: Npx;

Default Styling
Unordered List
Ordered List

Styles Applied into Context

Across the Sea of Space

The Stars Are Other Suns

Frontiers of discovery and imagination

For those who have seen the Earth from space, and for the hundreds and perhaps thousands more who will, the experience most certainly changes your perspective. Things that we share in our world are far more valuable than those which divide us.

The dreams of yesterday are the hopes of today and the reality of tomorrow.

Across the Sea of Space

The Stars Are Other Suns

Frontiers of discovery and imagination

For those who have seen the Earth from space, and for the hundreds and perhaps thousands more who will, the experience most certainly changes your perspective. Things that we share in our world are far more valuable than those which divide us.

The dreams of yesterday are the hopes of today and the reality of tomorrow.
